means: 不顾一切的，漫不经心的，自足的

sentence.Network_en: I love Italian food and wine and the devil-may-care attitude of the people.
sentence.Network_cn: 我喜欢意大利的食物、美酒和人们那种天塌当被盖的心态。

sentence.Network_en: His eye was alight, his color coppery, his air swagger, devil - may - care, bacchanal.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的眼睛发亮,面发铜色, 态度傲慢,不顾一切地发着酒疯.

sentence.Network_en: Alfred was a devil - may - care youth but became more serious as he grew older.
sentence.Network_cn: 艾尔弗雷德本是一个对什么都满不在乎的青年,但长在以后;他却变得认真起来.

entry.tran: 无所顾忌的;满不在乎的;逍遥自在的
entry.def: If you say that someone has a devil-may-care attitude, you mean that they seem relaxed and do not seem worried about the consequences of their actions.

example.ex: I love Italian food and wine and the devil-may-care attitude of the people.
example.tran: 我喜欢意大利的食物、美酒和人们那种天塌当被盖的心态。

means.word_mean: 2. marked by a carefree unconventionality or disreputableness;
